    • Method Detail

      • checkMove

        public boolean checkMove(GameState state,
                int x,
                int y)
        Returns whether a move can be untertaken by this Pawn. Pieces with an allegiance of 1 move up the board, and up the ranks. Pieces with an allegiance of -1 move down the board, and down the ranks. This method hecks to see if the target tile is on the next rank, then checks to see if the target tile is on the same file as this Pawn. Afterwards, this method checks to see if the target rank is within the range of permitted ranks, followed by verifying if the target tile doesn't contain friendly units.
        Specified by:
        checkMove in class Piece
        Parameters:
        state - The current state of the game at the time of verification.
        x - The x-value to which this piece is trying to move.
        y - The y-value to which this piece is trying to move.
        Returns:
        Whether this Pawn can move to the given x and y values.

      • move

        public GameState move(GameState state,
             int x,
             int y)
        Moves the piece, and captures any pieces at the target tile. Verifies if target tile is a valid move, and then moves the piece to that location. If the target tile is occupied by an enemy tile, it is captured, demoted, and placed in the drop table.
        Specified by:
        move in class Piece
        Parameters:
        x - The x-value to which this piece is trying to move.
        y - The y-value to which this piece is trying to move.
        state - The state of the game before the piece is moved.
        Returns:
        The state of the game after the piece is moved.

      • getPromotable

        public boolean getPromotable()
        Returns whether or not this pawn can promote. Uses the formula: (5+a)a < ay, where a is the allegiance number, and y is the y-value of this pawn. If allegiance is +!, then pawns promote in ranks 7, 8 and 9. If allegiance is -1, then pawns promote in ranks 1, 2 and 3. If allegiance is +1, the formula is 6 < y, which is true for ranks 7, 8 and 9. If allegiance is -1, the formula is -4 < -y, which is true for ranks 1, 2 and 3. Therefore the function works for all necessary occasions.
        Returns:
        Whether the pawn can promote in its current location.

      • promote

        public Piece promote()
        Returns the Piece this pawn promotes to. Creates a PromotedPawn with the same allegiance and location as this pawn.
        Specified by:
        promote in class Piece
        Returns:
        The PromotedPawn equivalent of this Pawn.

      • demote

        public Piece demote()
        Returns the piece this pawn demotes to. As pawns are not a promoted piece, demoting them has no effect.
        Specified by:
        demote in class Piece
        Returns:
        This pawn.
